update.description:
The motivation behind this PR is to clean up the way we remove visuals and it's ogre data structures. It's also a step towards abstracting gazebo rendering away from ogre. 

The expected behavior now is that when a visual is removed, its child visuals will also be removed. *Visual classes should not need to worry about cleaning up ogre-specific objects now, `Visual::Fini` should be sufficient in most cases.

- replaced ogre scene nodes in *Visual classes with child visuals

- added more *Visual unit tests

- re-enabled checks in `ModelMaker_TEST.cc` to verify visuals are removed

jenkins:

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/458/testReport/) - ok
update.title: Refactor Visual classes

content.raw: Confirmed fix, thanks
content.html: Confirmed fix, thanks

content.raw:
Error case:

1. View->Transparent
1. Insert a simple shape, and it is rendered opaque.
1. The simple shape will become transparent once it is moved
content.html:
Error case:

  1. View->Transparent
  2. Insert a simple shape, and it is rendered opaque.
  3. The simple shape will become transparent once it is moved

content.raw:
given that the delete key removes all selected visuals, there was no point calling `DeselectAll` any more (it also caused a crash due to dangling shared pointers). 

added `selectedModelPluginsclear()` in 3874575
content.html:
given that the delete key removes all selected visuals, there was no point calling DeselectAll any more (it also caused a crash due to dangling shared pointers).

added selectedModelPluginsclear() in 3874575

content.raw: I think it should work with just `AttachMesh` since it also calls `InsertMesh`. The API can be improved a little. I don't know if we need to expose `InsertMesh` at all. Something to think about later.
content.html: I think it should work with just AttachMesh since it also calls InsertMesh. The API can be improved a little. I don't know if we need to expose InsertMesh at all. Something to think about later.

content.raw: not necessarily. You can attach an object directly to *Visual classes and it'll be positioned at the center of the visual, but we tend to use child visuals so we can give them an offset pose.
content.html: not necessarily. You can attach an object directly to *Visual classes and it'll be positioned at the center of the visual, but we tend to use child visuals so we can give them an offset pose.
